sentences.en: " Legal, administrative and economic measures should be introduced to regulate the health industry. "
sentences.cn: 要运用法律 、 行政、经济等手段实行卫生行业管理.

sentences.en: A guardian of the person is entitled to regulate his education.
sentences.cn: 人身监护人有权安排他的教育.

sentences.en: Can you regulate this watch so that it keeps time accurately?
sentences.cn: 你能不能调一下这块表,让它走得准一些?

sentences.en: Hormones regulate many insect functions, including ecdysis and metamorphosis.
sentences.cn: 激素调节昆虫的许多功能，包括蜕皮和变态。

sentences.en: In practice, the most important of these federal powers is the power to regulate interstate commerce.
sentences.cn: 实际上, 这些联邦权力中最重要的是对州际商业的约束权.

sentences.en: Many burned patients will take oral fluid and regulate their own intake.
sentences.cn: 多数烧伤病人将经口饮水,而且自己调节入量.

sentences.en: People sweat to regulate their body heat.
Please regulate the sound on that radio.
sentences.cn: 请调一下那个收音机的音量.

sentences.en: Private schools regulate the behavior of students.
sentences.cn: 私立学校规范学生行为.

sentences.en: strict rules regulating the use of chemicals in food
sentences.cn: 限制化学品在食物中使用的严格规定

sentences.en: The AA called for laws to regulate clamping firms.
sentences.cn: 英国汽车协会呼吁立法，规范夹车公司的行为。

sentences.en: The control authority may also regulate the use of the domestic currency owned by foreign residents.
sentences.cn: 管汇当局对外国居民持有其本国的货币的使用也加以管制.

sentences.en: The powers of the European Commission to regulate competition are increasing.
sentences.cn: 欧盟委员会对竞争的监管权越来越大。

sentences.en: Thermostats can be used to regulate the temperature of a room.
sentences.cn: 恒温器可用来调节室内温度.

sentences.en: They regulate the flow of water by the sluice gate.
sentences.cn: 他们用水闸门控制水的流量.

sentences.en: This is what they call guidelines to regulate the market.
sentences.cn: 这就是他们所谓的调节市场的指导方针.

sentences.en: This system can regulate the temperature of the room.
sentences.cn: 这种系统能调节室内温度.

trans.tran_en: to control an activity or process, especially by rules

trans.tran_cn: 管理， 控制； 调整， 调节； 使规则化， 使条理化
trans.tran_en: to control an activity or process, especially by rules
